answers.answer: Well, I had preeclampsia with my first and I had to pee all the time. Lol. Short of it is you really can't tell just by symptoms. You're dox appointments are very important. And if you are going to have it, there is nothing you can do to prevent it, unfortunately. Like I said, just communicate with your doc a lot and try to take its easy.

It's not so bad. Can be a bit scary and worst case scenario, they may bed order you. I had to deliver 5 weeks early because she had no fluid around her! But she is good and healthy now. Would never guess she was a preemie! Try not to worry. You both will be fine! Best of luck.

question: I was told that high blood pressure and a sudden decrease in needing to pee is a sign of it. I'm 20 weeks and I just realized that my BP was a bit higher at my last apt and I barely have had to pee the past few days and I feel like crap :(
title: preeclampsia?
